\usepackage{cancel}

## Single-variable and three-variable models

In tree sample...

\bigskip

* trees $j$, where $c$, $h$, $h_{dec}$ are measured

$$
V_{bole}(j) = f_{III}(c, h, h_{dec})
$$

* *simplified* ou *remeasured* trees $i$, where $c$ is measured

$$
\cancel{ V_{bole}(i) = V_{bole}(j) }
\to
\cancel{ V_{bole}(i) = V_{bole}(j) \frac{c(i)}{c(j)} }
\to
V_{bole}(i) = V_{bole}(j) \frac{f_{I}(c(i))}{f_{I}(c(j))}
$$

## What we keep

* Data sets source
* Linear models
* Transformations

$$
\left\{
\begin{aligned}
V_{bole} & = \frac{c^2 h}{4 \pi \left( 1 - \frac{1{,}3}{h} \right)^2} f_{new} \\
f_{new} & = f_{III}(c, h, h_{dec})
\end{aligned}
\right.
$$

$$
log(V_{bole}) = f_{I}(log(c))
$$

## What we change

* Explanatory variables
  * $h_{dec}$ turns into $h_{dec}'$
  * variables are shared by every species
  * $f(g)$ is dropped
* Parameters
  * the three-variable model is no longer cut-specific

$$
f_{new} = \alpha + \beta c + \gamma \frac{\sqrt{c}}{h_{dec}'} + \delta \frac{\sqrt{h_{dec}'}}{c^2 h} + \eta \left( 1 - \frac{h_{dec}'}{h} \right)
$$

$$
V_{bole, I} = \mathrm{e}^{\alpha + \beta \ln(c) + \gamma \ln(c)^2 + \frac{\sigma^2}{2}}
$$
